      • fill

        public boolean fill(boolean block,
                    byte[] data,
                    int offset,
                    int length)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Fill the given array with data unless non-blocking is requested and no data is available. If any data is available then the buffer will be filled using blocking I/O.
        Parameters:
        block - Should the first read into the provided buffer be a blocking read or not.
        data - Buffer to fill
        offset - Position in buffer to start writing
        length - Number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        true if the buffer was filled otherwise false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O occurred while obtaining data with which to fill the buffer
